pr_title: KAFKA-4996: Fix findbugs multithreaded correctness warnings for streams

timeline.message: updated maxObservedTimestamp and localMetadata to be threadsafe

timeline.bodyText: Will this get us NullPointer? Do we need to get an initial value for localMetadata?
timeline.author: abbccdda

replies.bodyText: Hmm, why do we still keep it? Based on the reviews for previous version, I believe that there is some strict ordering for getting localMetadata initialized to be non-null on L352 first before hitting this logic, but still a null check sound more resilient to me, unless we want to have a NullPointerException to be thrown explicitly.
replies.author: abbccdda

replies.bodyText: This gets initialized during the rebalance and IQ isn't available until Streams has reached RUNNING.
replies.author: ableegoldman

replies.bodyText:
I looked through the StreamsMetadataState and it does seem like it could technically be null if this instance was never assigned any active or standby tasks at all, ever. That really shouldn't happen, but of course it can if you massively over-provisioned your app and we shouldn't throw an NPE over that.
Seems like this is actually an existing bug that we should fix. Then we can improve the initialization check on the side
replies.author: ableegoldman

timeline.bodyText:
We need to actually initialize this now, although we can just initialize the value to null. ie
private AtomicReference<StreamsMetadata> localMetadata = new AtomicReference<>(null);
timeline.author: ableegoldman
